categories.name: Voting
categories.definition: Used for voter registration or election participation.

categories.name: Health Care
categories.definition: Linked to access to health services or insurance.

categories.name: Social Welfare / Subsidies
categories.definition: Used to deliver government benefits like cash transfers or pensions.

categories.name: Banking / Financial Inclusion
categories.definition: Used to comply with financial KYC norms.

categories.name: Tax / Revenue
categories.definition: Linked to taxpayer identification or filing systems.

categories.name: Immigration / Border Control
categories.definition: Used at border crossings or in e-passport systems.

categories.name: Education
categories.definition: Required for school enrollment, exams, or scholarships.

categories.name: Private Sector Access
categories.definition: Used in telecom, banking, or e-commerce platforms.

categories.name: Multiple / All
categories.definition: Used in multiple/all domains.

system_name.name: System Name
system_name.title: Name of the system introduced for Digital IDs i.e. e-ID, Aadhaar, etc.

year_introduced.name: Year Introduced
year_introduced.title: What year was the current system first introduced.

international_partners.name: International Partners
international_partners.title: Who are the internation partners i.e. World Bank, UNDP, etc.

income_group.name: Income Group
income_group.title: The Income Group according to the World Bank.

categories.name: Low income
categories.definition: GNI per capita of $1,135 or less.

categories.name: Lower-middle income
categories.definition: GNI per capita between $1,136 and $4,465.

categories.name: Upper-middle income
categories.definition: GNI per capita between $4,466 and $13,845.

categories.name: High income
categories.definition: GNI per capita of $13,846 or more.

authentication_method.name: Authentication Method
authentication_method.title: The method(s) used to verify user identity.

categories.name: Biometric
categories.definition: Uses fingerprints, iris scans, facial recognition, or other physiological traits.

categories.name: Mobile SIM/OTP
categories.definition: Uses mobile phone numbers or one-time passcodes.

categories.name: Password/PIN
categories.definition: Uses traditional username-password or PIN login credentials.

categories.name: Cryptography
categories.definition: Public key cryptography, a system that uses a pair of digital keys.

categories.name: Multi-factor
categories.definition: Combines two or more methods (e.g., biometric and PIN).

id_medium.name: ID Medium
id_medium.title: The primary delivery mechanism or form factor for the digital ID.

categories.name: Smart Card
categories.definition: A physical card embedded with a chip that stores identity information, often used with biometric authentication or PINs.

categories.name: Mobile App
categories.definition: A smartphone application that allows users to access, store, or present their digital ID securely.

categories.name: Web Portal
categories.definition: A secure online website or dashboard through which users can access or verify their identity credentials.

categories.name: Hybrid
categories.definition: A combination of two or more mediums (e.g., smart card plus mobile app) that provide redundancy or flexibility across platforms.

data_protection.name: Data Protection Framework
data_protection.title: Legal and regulatory protection for digital identity data.

categories.name: Strong
categories.definition: Comprehensive laws with active enforcement and independent oversight.

categories.name: Moderate
categories.definition: Laws exist but are poorly enforced or outdated.

categories.name: Weak / None
categories.definition: No clear data protection laws or significant legal gaps.

inclusion_risk.name: Inclusion & Accessibility Risk
inclusion_risk.title: Risk of excluding populations due to infrastructure or legal barriers.

categories.name: High Risk
categories.definition: Large parts of the population face access or documentation challenges.

categories.name: Medium Risk
categories.definition: Partial access barriers exist, but mitigation programs are in place.

categories.name: Low Risk
categories.definition: High coverage and proactive inclusion strategies are present.

categories.name: Unknown
categories.definition: Lack of data or clarity on inclusion risks.

interoperability.name: Interoperability
interoperability.title: Extent to which the digital ID integrates with other systems.

categories.name: Cross-border Compatible
categories.definition: Designed for regional or international interoperability.

categories.name: National Integrated
categories.definition: Integrated across national government and public services.

categories.name: Siloed / Not Interoperable
categories.definition: Limited to specific systems or regions with no broad integration.

controversies.name: Known Controversies
controversies.title: Major risks, criticisms, or incidents associated with the ID system.

categories.name: Surveillance Concerns
categories.definition: Potential or actual misuse by state actors for tracking or profiling.

categories.name: Data Breaches
categories.definition: Incidents involving unauthorized access or exposure of personal data.

categories.name: Use in Deportation
categories.definition: Linked to immigration enforcement or cross-border expulsions.

categories.name: Exclusion or Discrimination
categories.definition: Marginalized groups are systematically excluded.

categories.name: Bureaucratic
categories.definition: Bureaucratic difficulties in getting an ID .

categories.name: None / Not Reported
categories.definition: No major controversies publicly documented.

technology_vendor.name: Technology Vendor
technology_vendor.title: Key private or public actors developing the ID system.

categories.name: IDEMIA
categories.definition: French multinational providing biometric and identity tech.

categories.name: Thales
categories.definition: Global security and identity technology company.

categories.name: Okta
categories.definition: Provider (IdP) for businesses, offering solutions to manage user identities and access across applications..

categories.name: Innovatrics
categories.definition: Slovak provider of biometric identification systems.

categories.name: Iris Corporation
categories.definition: Malaysian company known for e-passports and smart cards.

categories.name: Local or Government-built
categories.definition: Developed internally by domestic institutions or local firms.

categories.name: Undisclosed / Unknown
categories.definition: No public information on the system vendor.

funding_source.name: Funding / Sponsorship
funding_source.title: The main source of financial and technical support for the ID system.

categories.name: Domestic Budget
categories.definition: Fully funded by the national government.

categories.name: Public-Private Partnership (PPP)
categories.definition: Joint funding and development by government and private firms.

categories.name: International Donors
categories.definition: Supported by World Bank, UNDP, or other development partners.

categories.name: Private Sector-Led
categories.definition: Primarily initiated and implemented by private companies.

status.name: DID Status
status.title: The current stage of the national digital ID system.

categories.name: Operational
categories.definition: The digital ID system is officially deployed and in use by the general population or target groups.

categories.name: Pilot
categories.definition: A small-scale trial or regional test is being conducted to evaluate the functionality of the digital ID system.

categories.name: In Design Phase
categories.definition: The government has moved beyond research and is actively building technical infrastructure, software, or legal mechanisms and early testing of a DID in controlled environments.

categories.name: Scoping
categories.definition: The government is studying digital ID feasibility, conducting stakeholder consultations, or drafting legal/policy frameworks.

categories.name: No Initiative / Inactive
categories.definition: No official announcement or steps taken by the government toward establishing a digital ID system.

categories.name: Canceled
categories.definition: The digital ID project was officially terminated and is no longer being pursued.

categories.name: Other
categories.definition: No formal DID research.
